glosses: to be amazed at, be astonished at
to depart from (a way of behavior)
to make a mistake, be mistaken
(for a missile, a blow) to miss (its object)
to lose (one's way), to forget (what day it is)
(for something) not to take place at its usual time

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish شاشمق (şaşmak, “to miss one's way, to be surprised, be completely wildered”), from Proto-Turkic *siāĺ- (“to be astonished, to slander”). With rarely seen /s/- to /ş/- assimilation due to final /ş/. Compare similar examples such as: şişmek, şiş.
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (saş, “wild, nervous, confused, puzzled”), Azerbaijani çaşmaq (“to make mistakes, be confused”), Khalaj [script needed] (šašqa-, “to slander”), Turkmen çaşmak (“to faint, to be lost”).
